page.title: 07Tourism in the Nibley area
page.content: The tourist attraction of North Nibley is its closeness to Cotswold towns like Wotton and Dursley , and other important tourist sites like Berkeley Castle and Slimbridge Wildfowl Trust. The accommodation is good, as there are about six Bed and Breakfast (B&B) places.Most of them are old buildings or farmhouses.The average price for one night and breakfast is Â£12.Most of them have been doing B&B for six years.The area is excellent for walking and it is also a part of the Cotswold Way.There are lots of open fields and woods nearby to go for walks in.Many people who walk the Cotswold Way stop of at Bed and Breakfast houses.Lots of people come to Nibley because of its scenic beauty and peacefulness.There is also the nearby medieval church and pubs eg;The Black Horse and the New Inn.
